replies.body:
Wow the people who just come here to argue.

On the off chance you're serious, Ahri is a mobile mid with a long range poke.  Having an undodgeable stun is vastly more useful against her than other mids who don't dash around or gain large boosts of movement speed.  Having a long range poke helps keep you safe while laning because your possible damage radius is similar or larger than hers.

> [{quoted}](name=InsaneSamurai,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=kE0VN83w,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-07-24T22:38:45.462+0000)
>
> Wow the people who just come here to argue.
> 
> On the off chance you're serious, Ahri is a mobile mid with a long range poke.  Having an undodgeable stun is vastly more useful against her than other mids who don't dash around or gain large boosts of movement speed.  Having a long range poke helps keep you safe while laning because your possible damage radius is similar or larger than hers.

what's wrong with arguing?

I was told so in Season 4 when I first started playing her (ie, before the rework). She may be a little less effective now that she's less of an assassin, but she still has a mobility advantage and hard cc. I mean, he's pretty much dead at 6. Watch him use pick a card, ult past minions, charm, Q, dash to chase, Q again, dash to get out from turret. He can't do anything about it.

She can still beat him in lane, really.
I really don't know that much about mid matchups, but I feel like he would be strong against her because of his undodgable stun and long poke range.

> [{quoted}](name=InsaneSamurai,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=kE0VN83w,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-07-24T22:32:24.634+0000)
>
> I really don't know that much about mid matchups, but I feel like he would be strong against her because of his undodgable stun and long poke range.

so then tf counters everyone? (that "argument" can be used on everyone)
